intro: Diplazium furculicola, commonly known as the forked water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Thelypteridaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive fronds that are divided into two parts, giving it the common name "forked." The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its rhizomes are thick and creeping, allowing it to spread vegetatively. Diplazium furculicola is found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands.
